main event: On August 14, 1957, in Los Angeles, California, several objects the size of G.I. footballs were observed moving very rapidly at a low altitude. The objects appeared to have a brilliant illumination and were seen through binoculars for approximately 15 seconds.
interesting points: The sighting involved 3 to 6 objects, and their speed and duration indicated that they were not normal aircraft.
The objects disappeared into the clouds at high speed and were described as having extreme elevation.
A civilian jet pilot observed a UFO visually for 30 seconds in Los Angeles, California, and radar detected two unidentifiable objects at an altitude of 43,882 feet.
The observer estimated the speed of the objects at 1921-1535 knots, and their altitude exceeded 43,882 feet.
The report indicated that there was no possible explanation for the observed behavior.
sighted object: several objects the size of G.I. footballs with brilliant illumination
